question: A body is moving along a straight line with initial velocity <katex>$v_{0}$</katex> Its acceleration a is constant. After t seconds, its velocity becomes v. The average velocity of the body over the given time interval is
explanation: Average velocity for constant acceleration is <katex>$\frac{v+v_0}{2}$</katex>. Also <katex>$v^2 - v_0^2 = 2as \Rightarrow s = \frac{v^2-v_0^2}{2a}$</katex>. Average velocity <katex>$\bar{v} = s/t = \frac{v^2-v_0^2}{2at}$</katex>.
